00048 //Incremental graph -- maintains adjacency lists for values and vars
00049 #define INCGRAPH

00051 // Does not trigger itself if this is on, and incgraph is on.
00052 #define ONECALL

00055 
00056 // Note on semantics: GCC only restricts those values which are 'of interest',
00057 // it does not put any restriction on the number of other values. 
00058 
00059 template<typename VarArray1, typename VarArray2, int Strongcards>
00060 struct GCC : public AbstractConstraint
00061 {
00062     GCC(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray1& _var_array, const VarArray2& _capacity_array, ConstraintBlob& b) : AbstractConstraint(_stateObj),
00063     var_array(_var_array), capacity_array(_capacity_array), 
00064     numvals(count_values()), constraint_locked(false),
00065     SCCSplit(_stateObj, numvars+numvals)
00066     {
00067         GCCPRINT("numvars:"<< numvars << ", numvals:"<< numvals);
00068         val_array = b.constants[0];
00069         
00070         D_ASSERT(capacity_array.size()==val_array.size());
00071         
00072         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00073         {
00074             for(int j=i+1; j<val_array.size(); j++)
00075             {
00076                 D_ASSERT(val_array[i]!=val_array[j]);
00077             }
00078         }
00079         varvalmatching.resize(numvars, dom_min-1);
00080         usage.resize(numvals, 0);
00081         
00082         lower.resize(numvals, 0);
00083         upper.resize(numvals, numvars);
00084         
00085         prev.resize(numvars+numvals);
00086         initialize_tarjan();
00087         
00088         // SCC data structures
00089         SCCs.resize(numvars+numvals);
00090         varToSCCIndex.resize(numvars+numvals);
00091         for(int i=0; i<numvars+numvals; i++)
00092         {
00093             SCCs[i]=i;
00094             varToSCCIndex[i]=i;
00095         }
00096         
00097         vars_in_scc.reserve(numvars);
00098         vals_in_scc.reserve(numvals);
00099         // In case we are not using SCCs, fill the var and val arrays.
00100         vars_in_scc.clear();
00101         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00102         {
00103             vars_in_scc.push_back(i);
00104         }
00105         vals_in_scc.clear();
00106         for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++)
00107         {
00108             vals_in_scc.push_back(i);
00109         }
00110         
00111         to_process.reserve(numvars+numvals);
00112         sccs_to_process.reserve(numvars+numvals);
00113         
00114         // Array to let us find the appropriate capacity variable for a value. 
00115         val_to_cap_index.resize(numvals);
00116         for(int i=0; i<numvals; i++)
00117         {
00118             bool found=false;
00119             int j;
00120             for(j=0; j<val_array.size(); j++)
00121             {
00122                 if(val_array[j]==i+dom_min)
00123                 {
00124                     found=true; 
00125                     break;
00126                 }
00127             }
00128             
00129             if(!found)
00130             {
00131                 val_to_cap_index[i]=-1;
00132             }
00133             else
00134             {
00135                 val_to_cap_index[i]=j;
00136             }
00137         }
00138         GCCPRINT("val_to_cap_index:" << val_to_cap_index);
00139         
00140         augpath.reserve(numvars+numvals+1);
00141         //fifo.reserve(numvars+numvals);
00142         
00143         #ifdef INCGRAPH
00144             // refactor this to use initial upper and lower bounds.
00145             adjlist.resize(numvars+numvals);
00146             adjlistpos.resize(numvars+numvals);
00147             for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00148             {
00149                 adjlist[i].resize(numvals);
00150                 for(int j=0; j<numvals; j++) adjlist[i][j]=j+dom_min;
00151                 adjlistpos[i].resize(numvals);
00152                 for(int j=0; j<numvals; j++) adjlistpos[i][j]=j;
00153             }
00154             for(int i=numvars; i<numvars+numvals; i++)
00155             {
00156                 adjlist[i].resize(numvars);
00157                 for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++) adjlist[i][j]=j;
00158                 adjlistpos[i].resize(numvars);
00159                 for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++) adjlistpos[i][j]=j;
00160             }
00161             adjlistlength=getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().template requestArray<int>(numvars+numvals);
00162             for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++) adjlistlength[i]=numvals;
00163             for(int i=numvars; i<numvars+numvals; i++) adjlistlength[i]=numvars;
00164         #endif
00165         
00166         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00167         boundsupported.resize(numvals*2, -1);  
00168         // does the bound need to be updated? Indexed as validx*2 for lowerbound, validx*2+1 for ub
00169         // Contains the capacity value which is supported. Reset to -1 if the support is lost.
00170         #endif
00171     }
00172     
00173     VarArray1 var_array;   // primary variables
00174     VarArray2 capacity_array;   // capacities for values of interest
00175     vector<int> val_array;   // values of interest
00176     int dom_min, dom_max, numvars, numvals;
00177     
00178     #ifdef INCGRAPH
00179     vector<vector<int> > adjlist;
00180     MoveableArray<int> adjlistlength;
00181     vector<vector<int> > adjlistpos;   // position of a variable in adjlist.
00182     #endif
00183     
00184     int count_values()
00185     {
00186         // called in initializer list.
00187         numvars=var_array.size();  // number of target variables in the constraint
00188         if(var_array.size()>0)
00189         {
00190             dom_min=var_array[0].getInitialMin();
00191             dom_max=var_array[0].getInitialMax();
00192         }
00193         else
00194         {
00195             dom_min=0;
00196             dom_max=-1;  // avoids running the body of any loops which go from min to max
00197             return 0; // numvals
00198         }
00199         for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); ++i)
00200         {
00201           if(var_array[i].getInitialMin()<dom_min)
00202               dom_min=var_array[i].getInitialMin();
00203           if(var_array[i].getInitialMax()>dom_max)
00204               dom_max=var_array[i].getInitialMax();
00205         }
00206         return dom_max-dom_min+1;
00207     }
00208     
00209     vector<int> val_to_cap_index;
00210     
00211     bool constraint_locked;
00212     
00213     vector<int> vars_in_scc;
00214     vector<int> vals_in_scc;  // Actual values.
00215     
00216     virtual void full_propagate()
00217     {
00218         for(int i=0; i<capacity_array.size(); i++)
00219         {
00220             if(val_array[i]>=dom_min && val_array[i]<=dom_max)
00221             {
00222                 capacity_array[i].setMin(0);
00223                 capacity_array[i].setMax(numvars);
00224             }
00225             else
00226             {   // value can't occur.
00227                 capacity_array[i].propagateAssign(0);
00228             }
00229         }
00230         #ifdef INCGRAPH
00231         {
00232             // update the adjacency lists. and place dts
00233             DynamicTrigger* dt=dynamic_trigger_start();
00234             for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++)
00235             {
00236                 for(int j=0; j<adjlistlength[i-dom_min+numvars]; j++)
00237                 {
00238                     int var=adjlist[i-dom_min+numvars][j];
00239                     if(!var_array[var].inDomain(i))
00240                     {
00241                         if(varvalmatching[var]==i)
00242                         {
00243                             usage[varvalmatching[var]-dom_min]--;
00244                             varvalmatching[var]=dom_min-1;
00245                         }
00246                         // swap with the last element and remove
00247                         adjlist_remove(var, i);
00248                         j--; // stay in the same place, dont' skip over the 
00249                         // value which was just swapped into the current position.
00250                     }
00251                     else
00252                     {
00253                         // arranged in blocks for each variable, with numvals triggers in each block
00254                         DynamicTrigger* mydt= dt+(var*numvals)+(i-dom_min);
00255                         var_array[var].addDynamicTrigger(mydt, DomainRemoval, i);
00256                     }
00257                 }
00258             }
00259         }
00260         #endif
00261         
00262         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00263             DynamicTrigger* dt=dynamic_trigger_start();
00264             dt+=(numvars*numvals);
00265             for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00266             {
00267                 // lowerbound first
00268                 for(int j=0; j<(val_array.size()+numvars); j++)
00269                 {
00270                     dt->trigger_info()=(val_array[i]-dom_min)*2;
00271                     dt++;
00272                 }
00273                 // upperbound
00274                 for(int j=0; j<(val_array.size()+numvars); j++)
00275                 {
00276                     dt->trigger_info()=(val_array[i]-dom_min)*2+1;
00277                     dt++;
00278                 }
00279             }
00280         #endif
00281         
00282         #ifdef SCC
00283         for(int i=0; i<numvars+numvals; i++) to_process.insert(i);  // may need to change.
00284         do_gcc_prop_scc();
00285         #else
00286         do_gcc_prop();
00287         #endif
00288     }
00289     
00290     #ifdef INCGRAPH
00291     inline void adjlist_remove(int var, int val)
00292     {
00293         // swap item at position varidx to the end, then reduce the length by 1.
00294         int validx=val-dom_min+numvars;
00295         int varidx=adjlistpos[validx][var];
00296         D_ASSERT(varidx<adjlistlength[validx]);  // var is actually in the list.
00297         delfromlist(validx, varidx);
00298         
00299         delfromlist(var, adjlistpos[var][val-dom_min]);
00300     }
00301     
00302     inline void delfromlist(int i, int j)
00303     {
00304         // delete item in list i at position j
00305         int t=adjlist[i][adjlistlength[i]-1];
00306         adjlist[i][adjlistlength[i]-1]=adjlist[i][j];
00307         
00308         if(i<numvars)
00309         {
00310             adjlistpos[i][adjlist[i][j]-dom_min]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
00311             adjlistpos[i][t-dom_min]=j;
00312         }
00313         else
00314         {
00315             adjlistpos[i][adjlist[i][j]]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
00316             adjlistpos[i][t]=j;
00317         }
00318         adjlist[i][j]=t;
00319         adjlistlength[i]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
00320     }
00321     #endif
00322     
00323     // convert constraint into dynamic. 
00324     int dynamic_trigger_count()
00325     {
00326         #if defined(INCGRAPH) && !defined(CAPBOUNDSCACHE)
00327             return numvars*numvals; // one for each var-val pair so we know when it is removed.
00328         #endif
00329         
00330         #if !defined(INCGRAPH) && !defined(CAPBOUNDSCACHE)
00331             return 0;
00332         #endif
00333         
00334         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00335             // first numvars*numvals triggers are not used when INCGRAPH is not defined.
00336             // one block of numvars+val_Array.size() for each bound. 
00337             return numvars*numvals + 2*val_array.size()*(numvars+val_array.size());
00338         #endif
00339     }
00340     
00341     virtual void propagate(int prop_var, DomainDelta)
00342     {
00343         if(!to_process.in(prop_var))
00344         {
00345             to_process.insert(prop_var);  // inserts the number attached to the trigger. For values this is val-dom_min+numvars
00346         }
00347         
00348         if(!constraint_locked)
00349         {
00350             #ifdef SPECIALQUEUE
00351             constraint_locked = true;
00352             getQueue(stateObj).pushSpecialTrigger(this);
00353             #else
00354             #ifdef SCC
00355             do_gcc_prop_scc();
00356             #else
00357             do_gcc_prop();
00358             #endif
00359             #endif
00360         }
00361     }
00362     
00363     virtual void propagate(DynamicTrigger* trig)
00364     {
00365         DynamicTrigger* dtstart=dynamic_trigger_start();
00366         
00367         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00368         if(trig< dtstart+(numvars*numvals))
00369         #endif
00370         {
00371             // which var/val is this trigger attached to?
00372             #ifdef INCGRAPH
00373             int diff=trig-dtstart;
00374             int var=diff/numvals;
00375             int validx=diff%numvals;
00376             if(adjlistpos[validx+numvars][var]<adjlistlength[validx+numvars])
00377             {
00378                 adjlist_remove(var, validx+dom_min); //validx, adjlistpos[validx][var]);
00379                 if(varvalmatching[var]==validx+dom_min) // remove invalid value in the matching.
00380                 {
00381                     varvalmatching[var]=dom_min-1;
00382                     usage[validx]--;
00383                 }
00384                 // trigger the constraint here
00385                 #ifdef ONECALL
00386                 if(!to_process.in(var))
00387                 {
00388                     to_process.insert(var);  // add the var to the queue to be processed.
00389                 }
00390                 if(!constraint_locked)
00391                 {
00392                     #ifdef SPECIALQUEUE
00393                     constraint_locked = true;
00394                     getQueue(stateObj).pushSpecialTrigger(this);
00395                     #else
00396                     #ifdef SCC
00397                     do_gcc_prop_scc();
00398                     #else
00399                     do_gcc_prop();
00400                     #endif
00401                     #endif
00402                 }
00403                 #endif
00404             }
00405             // else the constraint triggered itself.
00406             #endif
00407         }
00408         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00409         else
00410         {
00411             //dtstart=dtstart+(numvars*numvals);
00412             D_ASSERT(trig>= dtstart && trig<dtstart+(2*val_array.size()*(numvars+val_array.size())) );
00413             // arranged in blocks per value. Then the first half of the block is for lower bound.
00414             /*int diff=trig-dtstart;
00415             int val_arrayidx=diff/((val_array.size()+numvars)*2);
00416             int value=val_array[val_arrayidx];
00417             int lbub=(diff/((val_array.size()+numvars)))%2;  // lowerbound or upperbound. SIMPLIFY HERE.
00418             boundsupported[(value-dom_min)*2+lbub]=-1;*/
00419             boundsupported[trig->trigger_info()]=-1;
00420         }
00421         #endif
00422     }
00423     
00424     #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
00425     vector<int> boundsupported;  // does the bound need to be updated? Indexed as validx*2 for lowerbound, validx*2+1 for ub
00426     // Contains the capacity value which is supported. Reset to -1 if the support is lost.
00427     #endif
00428     
00429     virtual void special_unlock() { constraint_locked = false;  } // to_process.clear(); why commented out?
00430   virtual void special_check()
00431   {
00432     constraint_locked = false;  // should be above the if.
00433     
00434     if(getState(stateObj).isFailed())
00435     {
00436         to_process.clear();
00437         return;
00438     }
00439     #ifdef SCC
00440     do_gcc_prop_scc();
00441     #else
00442     do_gcc_prop();
00443     #endif
00444     
00445   }
00446   
00447   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00448   {
00449       D_ASSERT(dom_max-dom_min+1 == numvals);
00450       // Check if the matching is OK.
00451       bool matchok=true;
00452       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00453       {
00454           if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00455           {
00456               matchok=false;
00457               break;
00458           }
00459       }
00460       if(matchok)
00461       {
00462           // now check occurrences
00463           for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00464           {
00465               int val=val_array[i];
00466               if( (val<dom_min || val>dom_max) && !capacity_array[i].inDomain(0))
00467               {
00468                   matchok=false;
00469                   break;
00470               }
00471               if( val>=dom_min && val<=dom_max && !capacity_array[i].inDomain(usage[val-dom_min]))  // is usage OK??
00472               {
00473                   matchok=false;
00474                   break;
00475               }
00476           }
00477       }
00478       
00479       if(!matchok)
00480       {
00481           // run matching algorithm
00482           // populate lower and upper
00483           // Also check if bounds are well formed.
00484         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00485         {
00486             if(val_array[i]>=dom_min && val_array[i]<=dom_max)
00487             {
00488                 if(capacity_array[i].getMax()<0 || capacity_array[i].getMin()>numvars)
00489                 {
00490                     return false;
00491                 }
00492                 lower[val_array[i]-dom_min]=capacity_array[i].getMin();
00493                 upper[val_array[i]-dom_min]=capacity_array[i].getMax();
00494             }
00495             else
00496             {
00497                 if(capacity_array[i].getMin()>0 || capacity_array[i].getMax()<0)
00498                 {
00499                     return false;
00500                 }
00501             }
00502         }
00503         
00504         #ifdef INCGRAPH
00505             // update the adjacency lists.
00506             for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++)
00507             {
00508                 for(int j=0; j<adjlistlength[i-dom_min+numvars]; j++)
00509                 {
00510                     int var=adjlist[i-dom_min+numvars][j];
00511                     if(!var_array[var].inDomain(i))
00512                     {
00513                         if(varvalmatching[var]==i)
00514                         {
00515                             usage[varvalmatching[var]-dom_min]--;
00516                             varvalmatching[var]=dom_min-1;
00517                         }
00518                         // swap with the last element and remove
00519                         adjlist_remove(var, i);
00520                         j--; // stay in the same place, dont' skip over the 
00521                         // value which was just swapped into the current position.
00522                     }
00523                 }
00524             }
00525         #endif
00526         
00527         // I'm sure that these four lines are needed, even though
00528         // if they are taken out, it still passes the random tests.
00529         // They are needed because the two vectors may be stale after
00530         // backtracking.
00531         vars_in_scc.clear();
00532         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++) vars_in_scc.push_back(i);
00533         vals_in_scc.clear();
00534         for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++) vals_in_scc.push_back(i);
00535         
00536         matchok=bfsmatching_gcc();
00537       }
00538       
00539       if(!matchok)
00540       {
00541           return false;
00542       }
00543       else
00544       {
00545           for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00546           {
00547               D_ASSERT(var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]));
00548               assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, varvalmatching[i]));
00549           }
00550           for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00551           {
00552               int occ;
00553               if(val_array[i]<dom_min || val_array[i]>dom_max)
00554               {
00555                   occ=0;
00556               }
00557               else
00558               {
00559                   occ=usage[val_array[i]-dom_min];
00560               }
00561               
00562              if(capacity_array[i].inDomain(occ))
00563              {
00564                  assignment.push_back(make_pair(i+numvars, occ));
00565              }
00566              else
00567              {
00568                  // push upper and lower bounds.
00569                  assignment.push_back(make_pair(i+numvars, capacity_array[i].getMin()));
00570                  assignment.push_back(make_pair(i+numvars, capacity_array[i].getMax()));                 
00571              }
00572           }
00573           return true;
00574       }
00575   }
00576   
00577     void do_gcc_prop()
00578     {
00579         // find/ repair the matching.
00580         #ifndef INCREMENTALMATCH
00581         varvalmatching.resize(0);
00582         varvalmatching.resize(numvars, dom_min-1);
00583         #endif
00584         
00585         // populate lower and upper
00586         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
00587         {
00588             if(val_array[i]>=dom_min && val_array[i]<=dom_max)
00589             {
00590                 lower[val_array[i]-dom_min]=capacity_array[i].getMin();   // not quite right in the presence of duplicate values.
00591                 upper[val_array[i]-dom_min]=capacity_array[i].getMax();
00592             }
00593         }
00594         
00595         GCCPRINT("lower:"<<lower);
00596         GCCPRINT("upper:"<<upper);
00597         
00598         bool flag=bfsmatching_gcc();
00599         GCCPRINT("matching:"<<flag);
00600         
00601         if(!flag)
00602         {
00603             getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00604             return;
00605         }
00606         
00607         tarjan_recursive(0);
00608         
00609         prop_capacity();
00610         
00611     }
00612     
00613     smallset sccs_to_process;
00614     
00615     void do_gcc_prop_scc()
00616     {
00617         // Assumes triggered on variables in to_process
00618         #ifndef INCREMENTALMATCH
00619         varvalmatching.resize(0);
00620         varvalmatching.resize(numvars, dom_min-1);
00621         #endif
00622         
00623         sccs_to_process.clear(); 
00624         {
00625         vector<int>& toiterate = to_process.getlist();
00626         GCCPRINT("About to loop for to_process.");
00627         
00628         // to_process contains var indexes and vals:
00629         // (val-dom_min +numvars)
00630         
00631         for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
00632         {
00633             int tempidx=toiterate[i];
00634             
00635             int sccindex_start=varToSCCIndex[tempidx];
00636             
00637             while(sccindex_start>0 && SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex_start-1))
00638             {
00639                 sccindex_start--;   // seek the first item in the SCC.
00640             }
00641             
00642             if(!sccs_to_process.in(sccindex_start) 
00643                 && SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex_start))   // not singleton.
00644             {
00645                 sccs_to_process.insert(sccindex_start);
00646             }
00647         }
00648         }
00649         
00650         {
00651         vector<int>& toiterate = sccs_to_process.getlist();
00652         GCCPRINT("About to loop for sccs_to_process:"<< toiterate);
00653         for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); i++)
00654         {
00655             int sccindex_start=toiterate[i];
00656             vars_in_scc.clear();
00657             vals_in_scc.clear();
00658             for(int j=sccindex_start; j<(numvars+numvals); j++)
00659             {
00660                 // copy vars and vals in the scc into two vectors.
00661                 int sccval=SCCs[j];
00662                 if(sccval<numvars)
00663                 {
00664                     D_ASSERT(sccval>=0);
00665                     vars_in_scc.push_back(sccval);
00666                 }
00667                 else
00668                 {
00669                     D_ASSERT(sccval<numvars+numvals);
00670                     vals_in_scc.push_back(sccval-numvars+dom_min);
00671                 }
00672                 
00673                 if(!SCCSplit.isMember(j)) break;
00674             }
00675             GCCPRINT("vars_in_scc:" << vars_in_scc);
00676             GCCPRINT("vals_in_scc:" << vals_in_scc);
00677             
00678             // Might not need to do anything.
00679             if(vars_in_scc.size()==0)
00680             {
00681                 GCCPRINT("refusing to process empty scc.");
00682                 continue;
00683             }
00684             
00685             // populate lower and upper
00686             for(int i=0; i<vals_in_scc.size(); i++)
00687             {
00688                 int validx=vals_in_scc[i]-dom_min;
00689                 int capi=val_to_cap_index[validx];
00690                 if(capi>-1)
00691                 {
00692                     lower[validx]=capacity_array[capi].getMin();
00693                     upper[validx]=capacity_array[capi].getMax();
00694                 }
00695             }
00696             
00697             bool flag=bfsmatching_gcc();
00698             if(!flag)
00699             {
00700                 GCCPRINT("Failing because no matching");
00701                 getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00702                 return;
00703             }
00704             
00705             tarjan_recursive(sccindex_start);
00706             
00707             #if defined(SCCCARDS)
00708             if(Strongcards)
00709             {
00710                 // Propagate to capacity variables for all values in vals_in_scc
00711                 for(int valinscc=0; valinscc<vals_in_scc.size(); valinscc++)
00712                 {
00713                     int v=vals_in_scc[valinscc];
00714                     if(val_to_cap_index[v-dom_min]!=-1 && lower[v-dom_min]!=upper[v-dom_min])
00715                     {
00716                         prop_capacity_strong_scc(v);
00717                     }
00718                 }
00719             }
00720             #endif
00721             
00722         }
00723         }
00724         
00725         #if !defined(SCCCARDS) || !defined(STRONGCARDS)
00726             prop_capacity();
00727         #endif
00728         
00729         #if defined(SCCCARDS)
00730         if(!Strongcards)
00731         {
00732             prop_capacity();
00733         }
00734         #endif
00735         
00736         // temporary to test without strong upperbound pruning.
00737         #if defined(SCCCARDS)
00738         if(Strongcards)
00739         {
00740             prop_capacity_simple();
00741         }
00742         #endif
00743     }
00744     
00745     deque<int> fifo;
00746     // deque_fixed_size was not faster.
00747     //deque_fixed_size fifo;
00748     vector<int> prev;
00749     
00750     vector<int> matchbac;
00751     
00752     vector<int> lower;
00753     vector<int> upper;
00754     vector<int> usage;
00755     vector<int> usagebac;
00756     vector<int> varvalmatching;
00757     
00758     // Incremental SCC data.
00759     vector<int> SCCs;    // Variable numbers and values as val-dom_min+numvars
00760     ReversibleMonotonicSet SCCSplit;
00761     
00762     vector<int> varToSCCIndex;  // Mirror of the SCCs array.
00763     
00764     smallset to_process;
00765     
00766     inline bool bfsmatching_gcc()
00767     {
00768         // lower and upper are indexed by value-dom_min and provide the capacities.
00769         // usage is the number of times a value is used in the matching.
00770         
00771         // current sccs are contained in vars_in_scc and vals_in_scc
00772         
00773         // back up the matching to cover failure
00774         //matchbac=varvalmatching;
00775         //usagebac=usage;
00776         
00777         // clear out unmatched variables -- unless this has already been done 
00778         // when the adjacency lists were updated.
00779         #ifndef INCGRAPH
00780         for(int scci=0; scci<vars_in_scc.size(); scci++)
00781         {
00782             int i=vars_in_scc[scci];
00783             if(varvalmatching[i]!=dom_min-1
00784                 && !var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00785             {
00786                 usage[varvalmatching[i]-dom_min]--;
00787                 varvalmatching[i]=dom_min-1;   // marker for unmatched.
00788             }
00789         }
00790         #endif
00791         
00792         // If the upper bounds have been changed since last call, it is possible that
00793         // the usage[val] of some value is greater than upper[val]. This is impossible
00794         // in the flow graph, so it must be corrected before we run the algorithm.
00795         // Some values in the matching are changed to blank (dom_min-1).
00796         for(int valsccindex=0; valsccindex<vals_in_scc.size(); valsccindex++)
00797         {
00798             int valindex=vals_in_scc[valsccindex]-dom_min;
00799             if(usage[valindex]>upper[valindex] && upper[valindex]>=0)
00800             {
00801                 for(int i=0; i<vars_in_scc.size() && usage[valindex]>upper[valindex]; i++)
00802                 {
00803                     int j=vars_in_scc[i];
00804                     if(varvalmatching[j]==valindex+dom_min)
00805                     {
00806                         varvalmatching[j]=dom_min-1;
00807                         usage[valindex]--;
00808                     }
00809                 }
00810                 D_ASSERT(usage[valindex]==upper[valindex]);
00811             }
00812         }
00813         
00814         // iterate through the values looking for ones which are below their lower capacity bound. 
00815         for(int startvalsccindex=0; startvalsccindex<vals_in_scc.size(); startvalsccindex++)
00816         {
00817             int startvalindex=vals_in_scc[startvalsccindex]-dom_min;
00818             while(usage[startvalindex]<lower[startvalindex])
00819             {
00820                 // usage of val needs to increase. Construct an augmenting path starting at val.
00821                 GCCPRINT("Searching for augmenting path for val: " << startvalindex+dom_min);
00822                 // Matching edge lost; BFS search for augmenting path to fix it.
00823                 fifo.clear();  // this should be constant time but probably is not.
00824                 fifo.push_back(startvalindex+numvars);
00825                 visited.clear();
00826                 visited.insert(startvalindex+numvars);
00827                 bool finished=false;
00828                 while(!fifo.empty() && !finished)
00829                 {
00830                     // pop a vertex and expand it.
00831                     int curnode=fifo.front();
00832                     fifo.pop_front();
00833                     GCCPRINT("Popped vertex " << (curnode<numvars? "(var)":"(val)") << (curnode<numvars? curnode : curnode+dom_min-numvars ));
00834                     if(curnode<numvars)
00835                     { // it's a variable
00836                         // follow the matching edge, if there is one.
00837                         int valtoqueue=varvalmatching[curnode];
00838                         if(valtoqueue!=dom_min-1 
00839                             && !visited.in(valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars))
00840                         {
00841                             D_ASSERT(var_array[curnode].inDomain(valtoqueue));
00842                             int validx=valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars;
00843                             if(usage[valtoqueue-dom_min]>lower[valtoqueue-dom_min])
00844                             {
00845                                 // can reduce the flow of valtoqueue to increase startval.
00846                                 prev[validx]=curnode;
00847                                 apply_augmenting_path(validx, startvalindex+numvars);
00848                                 finished=true;
00849                             }
00850                             else
00851                             {
00852                                 visited.insert(validx);
00853                                 prev[validx]=curnode;
00854                                 fifo.push_back(validx);
00855                             }
00856                         }
00857                     }
00858                     else
00859                     { // popped a value from the stack.
00860                         D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode < numvars+numvals);
00861                         int stackval=curnode+dom_min-numvars;
00862                         #ifndef INCGRAPH
00863                         for(int vartoqueuescc=0; vartoqueuescc<vars_in_scc.size(); vartoqueuescc++)
00864                         {
00865                             int vartoqueue=vars_in_scc[vartoqueuescc];
00866                         #else
00867                         for(int vartoqueuei=0; vartoqueuei<adjlistlength[stackval-dom_min+numvars]; vartoqueuei++)
00868                         {
00869                             int vartoqueue=adjlist[stackval-dom_min+numvars][vartoqueuei];
00870                         #endif
00871                             // For each variable, check if it terminates an odd alternating path
00872                             // and also queue it if it is suitable.
00873                             if(!visited.in(vartoqueue)
00874                                 #ifndef INCGRAPH
00875                                 && var_array[vartoqueue].inDomain(stackval)
00876                                 #endif
00877                                 && varvalmatching[vartoqueue]!=stackval)   // Need to exclude the matching edges????
00878                             {
00879                                 // there is an edge from stackval to vartoqueue.
00880                                 if(varvalmatching[vartoqueue]==dom_min-1)
00881                                 {
00882                                     // vartoqueue terminates an odd alternating path.
00883                                     // Unwind and apply the path here
00884                                     prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
00885                                     apply_augmenting_path(vartoqueue, startvalindex+numvars);
00886                                     finished=true;
00887                                     break;  // get out of for loop
00888                                 }
00889                                 else
00890                                 {
00891                                     // queue vartoqueue
00892                                     visited.insert(vartoqueue);
00893                                     prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
00894                                     fifo.push_back(vartoqueue);
00895                                 }
00896                             }
00897                         }  // end for.
00898                     }  // end value
00899                 }  // end while
00900                 if(!finished)
00901                 {   // no augmenting path found
00902                     GCCPRINT("No augmenting path found.");
00903                     // restore the matching to its state before the algo was called.
00904                     //varvalmatching=matchbac;
00905                     //usage=usagebac;
00906                     return false;
00907                 }
00908                 
00909             }  // end while below lower bound.
00910         } // end for each value
00911         
00912         // now search for augmenting paths for unmatched vars.
00913         
00914         GCCPRINT("feasible matching (respects lower & upper bounds):"<<varvalmatching);
00915         
00916         // Flip the graph around, so it's like the alldiff case now. 
00917         // follow an edge in the matching from a value to a variable,
00918         // follow edges not in the matching from variables to values. 
00919         
00920         for(int startvarscc=0; startvarscc<vars_in_scc.size(); startvarscc++)
00921         {
00922             int startvar=vars_in_scc[startvarscc];
00923             if(varvalmatching[startvar]==dom_min-1)
00924             {
00925                 GCCPRINT("Searching for augmenting path for var: " << startvar);
00926                 fifo.clear();  // this should be constant time but probably is not.
00927                 fifo.push_back(startvar);
00928                 visited.clear();
00929                 visited.insert(startvar);
00930                 bool finished=false;
00931                 while(!fifo.empty() && !finished)
00932                 {
00933                     // pop a vertex and expand it.
00934                     int curnode=fifo.front();
00935                     fifo.pop_front();
00936                     GCCPRINT("Popped vertex " << (curnode<numvars? "(var)":"(val)") << (curnode<numvars? curnode : curnode+dom_min-numvars ));
00937                     if(curnode<numvars)
00938                     { // it's a variable
00939                         // follow all edges other than the matching edge. 
00940                         #ifndef INCGRAPH
00941                         for(int valtoqueue=var_array[curnode].getMin(); valtoqueue<=var_array[curnode].getMax(); valtoqueue++)
00942                         {
00943                         #else
00944                         for(int valtoqueuei=0; valtoqueuei<adjlistlength[curnode]; valtoqueuei++)
00945                         {
00946                             int valtoqueue=adjlist[curnode][valtoqueuei];
00947                         #endif
00948                             // For each value, check if it terminates an odd alternating path
00949                             // and also queue it if it is suitable.
00950                             int validx=valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars;
00951                             if(valtoqueue!=varvalmatching[curnode]
00952                             #ifndef INCGRAPH
00953                                 && var_array[curnode].inDomain(valtoqueue)
00954                             #endif
00955                                 && !visited.in(validx) )
00956                             {
00957                                 //D_ASSERT(find(vals_in_scc.begin(), vals_in_scc.end(), valtoqueue)!=vals_in_scc.end()); // the value is in the scc.
00958                                 // Does this terminate an augmenting path?
00959                                 if(usage[valtoqueue-dom_min]<upper[valtoqueue-dom_min])
00960                                 {
00961                                     // valtoqueue terminates an alternating path.
00962                                     // Unwind and apply the path here
00963                                     prev[validx]=curnode;
00964                                     apply_augmenting_path_reverse(validx, startvar);
00965                                     finished=true;
00966                                     break;  // get out of for loop
00967                                 }
00968                                 else
00969                                 {
00970                                     // queue valtoqueue
00971                                     visited.insert(validx);
00972                                     prev[validx]=curnode;
00973                                     fifo.push_back(validx);
00974                                 }
00975                             }
00976                         }  // end for.
00977                     }
00978                     else
00979                     { // popped a value from the stack.
00980                         D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode < numvars+numvals);
00981                         int stackval=curnode+dom_min-numvars;
00982                         #ifndef INCGRAPH
00983                         for(int vartoqueuescc=0; vartoqueuescc<vars_in_scc.size(); vartoqueuescc++)
00984                         {
00985                             int vartoqueue=vars_in_scc[vartoqueuescc];
00986                         #else
00987                         for(int vartoqueuei=0; vartoqueuei<adjlistlength[curnode]; vartoqueuei++)
00988                         {
00989                             int vartoqueue=adjlist[curnode][vartoqueuei];
00990                         #endif
00991                             // For each variable which is matched to stackval, queue it.
00992                             if(!visited.in(vartoqueue)
00993                                 && varvalmatching[vartoqueue]==stackval)
00994                             {
00995                                 D_ASSERT(var_array[vartoqueue].inDomain(stackval));
00996                                 // there is an edge from stackval to vartoqueue.
00997                                 // queue vartoqueue
00998                                 visited.insert(vartoqueue);
00999                                 prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
01000                                 fifo.push_back(vartoqueue);
01001                             }
01002                         }  // end for.
01003                     }  // end value
01004                 }  // end while
01005                 if(!finished)
01006                 {   // no augmenting path found
01007                     GCCPRINT("No augmenting path found.");
01008                     // restore the matching to its state before the algo was called.
01009                     //varvalmatching=matchbac;   // no need for this.
01010                     //usage=usagebac;
01011                     return false;
01012                 }
01013             }
01014         }
01015         
01016         GCCPRINT("maximum matching:" << varvalmatching);
01017         return true;
01018     }
01019     
01020     vector<int> augpath;
01021     
01022     inline void apply_augmenting_path(int unwindnode, int startnode)
01023     {
01024         augpath.clear();
01025         // starting at unwindnode, unwind the path and put it in augpath.
01026         // Then apply it.
01027         // Assumes prev contains vertex numbers, rather than vars and values.
01028         int curnode=unwindnode;
01029         while(curnode!=startnode)
01030         {
01031             augpath.push_back(curnode);
01032             curnode=prev[curnode];
01033         }
01034         augpath.push_back(curnode);
01035         
01036         std::reverse(augpath.begin(), augpath.end());
01037         
01038         GCCPRINT("Found augmenting path:" << augpath);
01039         
01040         // now apply the path.
01041         for(int i=0; i<augpath.size()-1; i++)
01042         {
01043             if(augpath[i]<numvars)
01044             {
01045                 // if it's a variable
01046                 //D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[augpath[i]]==dom_min-1);
01047                 // varvalmatching[augpath[i]]=dom_min-1; Can't do this, it would overwrite the correct value.
01048                 GCCPRINT("decrementing usage for value " << augpath[i+1]-numvars+dom_min);
01049                 usage[augpath[i+1]-numvars]--;
01050             }
01051             else
01052             {   // it's a value.
01053                 D_ASSERT(augpath[i]>=numvars && augpath[i]<numvars+numvals);
01054                 varvalmatching[augpath[i+1]]=augpath[i]-numvars+dom_min;
01055                 GCCPRINT("incrementing usage for value " << augpath[i]-numvars+dom_min);
01056                 usage[augpath[i]-numvars]++;
01057             }
01058         }
01059         
01060         GCCPRINT("varvalmatching: "<<varvalmatching);
01061     }
01062     
01063     inline void apply_augmenting_path_reverse(int unwindnode, int startnode)
01064     {
01065         augpath.clear();
01066         // starting at unwindnode, unwind the path and put it in augpath.
01067         // Then apply it.
01068         // Assumes prev contains vertex numbers, rather than vars and values.
01069         int curnode=unwindnode;
01070         while(curnode!=startnode)
01071         {
01072             augpath.push_back(curnode);
01073             curnode=prev[curnode];
01074         }
01075         augpath.push_back(curnode);
01076         
01077         std::reverse(augpath.begin(), augpath.end());
01078         GCCPRINT("Found augmenting path:" << augpath);
01079         
01080         // now apply the path.
01081         for(int i=0; i<augpath.size()-1; i++)
01082         {
01083             if(augpath[i]<numvars)
01084             {
01085                 // if it's a variable
01086                 D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[augpath[i]]==dom_min-1);
01087                 varvalmatching[augpath[i]]=augpath[i+1]-numvars+dom_min;
01088                 usage[augpath[i+1]-numvars]++;
01089             }
01090             else
01091             {   // it's a value.
01092                 D_ASSERT(augpath[i]>=numvars && augpath[i]<numvars+numvals);
01093                 varvalmatching[augpath[i+1]]=dom_min-1;
01094                 usage[augpath[i]-numvars]--;
01095             }
01096         }
01097         
01098         GCCPRINT("varvalmatching:" << varvalmatching);
01099     }
01100     
01101     virtual string constraint_name()
01102     {
01103       return "GCC";
01104     }
01105     
01106     virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
01107     {
01108         triggerCollection t;
01109         int capacity_size=capacity_array.size();
01110         
01111         #if !defined(INCGRAPH) || !defined(ONECALL)
01112             int array_size = var_array.size();
01113             for(int i = 0; i < array_size; ++i)
01114             {
01115                 t.push_back(make_trigger(var_array[i], Trigger(this, i), DomainChanged));
01116             }
01117         #endif
01118         
01119         for(int i=0; i< capacity_size; ++i)
01120         {
01121             if(val_array[i]>=dom_min && val_array[i]<=dom_max)
01122             {
01123                 t.push_back(make_trigger(capacity_array[i], Trigger(this, val_array[i]-dom_min + numvars), UpperBound));
01124                 t.push_back(make_trigger(capacity_array[i], Trigger(this, val_array[i]-dom_min + numvars), LowerBound));
01125             }
01126         }
01127         return t;
01128     }
01129     
01130     virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
01131     {
01132       vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
01133       vars.reserve(var_array.size());
01134       for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
01135         vars.push_back(var_array[i]);
01136       for(unsigned i = 0; i < capacity_array.size(); ++i)
01137         vars.push_back(capacity_array[i]);
01138       return vars;
01139     }
01140     
01141     virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int vsize)
01142     {
01143       D_ASSERT(vsize == var_array.size()+capacity_array.size());
01144       // borrow augpath array
01145       GCCPRINT("In check_assignment with array:[");
01146       for(int i=0; i<vsize; i++) GCCPRINT( v[i] <<",");
01147       GCCPRINT("]");
01148       augpath.clear();
01149       augpath.resize(numvals, 0);
01150       
01151       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01152       {   // count the values.
01153           augpath[v[i]-dom_min]++;
01154       }
01155       for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
01156       {
01157           int val=val_array[i];
01158           if(val>=dom_min && val<=dom_max)
01159           {
01160               if(v[i+numvars]!=augpath[val-dom_min])
01161               {
01162                   return false;
01163               }
01164           }
01165           else
01166           {
01167               if(v[i+numvars]!=0)
01168               {
01169                   return false;
01170               }
01171           }
01172       }
01173       return true;
01174     }
01175     
01177     //
01178     // Tarjan's algorithm 
01179     
01180     
01181     vector<int> tstack;
01182     smallset_nolist in_tstack;
01183     smallset_nolist visited;
01184     vector<int> dfsnum;
01185     vector<int> lowlink;
01186     
01187     vector<int> curnodestack;
01188     
01189     bool scc_split;
01190     
01191     int sccindex;
01192     
01193     int max_dfs;
01194     
01195     smallset valinlocalmatching;
01196     smallset varinlocalmatching;
01197     
01198     int varcount, valcount;
01199     //int localmin,localmax;
01200     
01201     void initialize_tarjan()
01202     {
01203         int numnodes=numvars+numvals+1;  // One sink node.
01204         tstack.reserve(numnodes);
01205         in_tstack.reserve(numnodes);
01206         visited.reserve(numnodes);
01207         max_dfs=1;
01208         scc_split=false;
01209         dfsnum.resize(numnodes);
01210         lowlink.resize(numnodes);
01211         
01212         //iterationstack.resize(numnodes);
01213         curnodestack.reserve(numnodes);
01214         
01215         //valinlocalmatching.reserve(numvals);
01216         varinlocalmatching.reserve(numvars);
01217     }
01218     
01219     void tarjan_recursive(int sccindex_start)
01220     {
01221         tstack.clear();
01222         in_tstack.clear();
01223         
01224         visited.clear();
01225         max_dfs=1;
01226         
01227         scc_split=false;
01228         sccindex=sccindex_start;
01229         
01230         for(int i=0; i<vars_in_scc.size(); ++i)
01231         {
01232             int curnode=vars_in_scc[i];
01233             if(!visited.in(curnode))
01234             {
01235                 GCCPRINT("(Re)starting tarjan's algorithm, at node:"<< curnode);
01236                 varcount=0; valcount=0;
01237                 visit(curnode, true);
01238                 GCCPRINT("Returned from tarjan's algorithm.");
01239             }
01240         }
01241         
01242         // Also make sure all vals have been visited, so that values which
01243         // are in singleton SCCs are removed from all vars. 
01244         for(int i=0; i<vals_in_scc.size(); ++i)
01245         {
01246             int curnode=vals_in_scc[i]-dom_min+numvars;
01247             if(!visited.in(curnode))
01248             {
01249                 GCCPRINT("(Re)starting tarjan's algorithm, at node:"<< curnode);
01250                 varcount=0; valcount=0;
01251                 visit(curnode, true);
01252                 GCCPRINT("Returned from tarjan's algorithm.");
01253             }
01254         }
01255     }
01256     
01257     void visit(int curnode, bool toplevel)
01258     {
01259         // toplevel is true iff this is the top level of the recursion.
01260         tstack.push_back(curnode);
01261         in_tstack.insert(curnode);
01262         dfsnum[curnode]=max_dfs;
01263         lowlink[curnode]=max_dfs;
01264         max_dfs++;
01265         visited.insert(curnode);
01266         GCCPRINT("Visiting node: " <<curnode);
01267         
01268         if(curnode==numvars+numvals)
01269         {
01270             //cout << "Visiting sink node." <<endl;
01271             // It's the sink so it links to all spare values.
01272             /*
01273             for(int i=0; i<spare_values.size(); ++i)
01274             {
01275                 int newnode=spare_values[i];
01276                 //cout << "About to visit spare value: " << newnode-numvars+dom_min <<endl;
01277                 if(!visited.in(newnode))
01278                 {
01279                     visit(newnode);
01280                     if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01281                     {
01282                         lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01283                     }
01284                 }
01285                 else
01286                 {
01287                     // Already visited newnode
01288                     if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01289                     {
01290                         lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01291                     }
01292                 }
01293             }*/
01294             
01295             // GCC mod:
01296             // link to any value which is below its upper cap.
01297             GCCPRINT("usage:"<<usage);
01298             GCCPRINT("upper:"<<upper);
01299             
01300             for(int j=0; j<vals_in_scc.size(); j++)
01301             {
01302                 int i=vals_in_scc[j];
01303                 int newnode=i+numvars-dom_min;
01304                 if(usage[i-dom_min]<upper[i-dom_min])
01305                 {
01306                     GCCPRINT("val "<< i << "below upper cap.");
01307                     if(!visited.in(newnode))
01308                     {
01309                         visit(newnode, false);
01310                         if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01311                         {
01312                             lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01313                         }
01314                     }
01315                     else
01316                     {
01317                         // Already visited newnode
01318                         if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01319                         {
01320                             lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01321                         }
01322                     }
01323                 }
01324             }
01325         }
01326         else if(curnode<numvars)  // This case should never occur with merge nodes.
01327         {
01328             D_ASSERT(find(vars_in_scc.begin(), vars_in_scc.end(), curnode)!=vars_in_scc.end());
01329             varcount++;
01330             int newnode=varvalmatching[curnode]-dom_min+numvars;
01331             D_ASSERT(var_array[curnode].inDomain(newnode+dom_min-numvars));
01332             
01333             if(!visited.in(newnode))
01334             {
01335                 visit(newnode, false);
01336                 if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01337                 {
01338                     lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01339                 }
01340             }
01341             else
01342             {
01343                 // Already visited newnode
01344                 if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01345                 {
01346                     lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];  // Why dfsnum not lowlink?
01347                 }
01348             }
01349         }
01350         else
01351         {
01352             // curnode is a value
01353             // This is the only case where watches are set.
01354             //cout << "Visiting node val: "<< curnode+dom_min-numvars <<endl;
01355             valcount++;
01356             D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode<(numvars+numvals));
01357             #ifndef NO_DEBUG
01358             bool found=false;
01359             for(int i=0; i<vars_in_scc.size(); i++)
01360             {
01361                 if(var_array[vars_in_scc[i]].inDomain(curnode+dom_min-numvars))
01362                 {
01363                     found=true;
01364                 }
01365             }
01366             // D_ASSERT(found);  // it is safe to take out this test. But how did we get to this value?
01367             #endif
01368             
01369             int lowlinkvar=-1;
01370             #ifndef INCGRAPH
01371             for(int i=0; i<vars_in_scc.size(); i++)
01372             {
01373                 int newnode=vars_in_scc[i];
01374             #else
01375             for(int i=0; i<adjlistlength[curnode]; i++)
01376             {
01377                 int newnode=adjlist[curnode][i];
01378             #endif
01379                 if(varvalmatching[newnode]!=curnode-numvars+dom_min)   // if the value is not in the matching.
01380                 {
01381                     #ifndef INCGRAPH
01382                     if(var_array[newnode].inDomain(curnode+dom_min-numvars))
01383                     #endif
01384                     {
01385                         //newnode=varvalmatching[newnode]-dom_min+numvars;  // Changed here for merge nodes
01386                         if(!visited.in(newnode))
01387                         {
01388                             
01389                             visit(newnode, false);
01390                             if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01391                             {
01392                                 lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01393                                 lowlinkvar=-1;   // Would be placing a watch where there already is one.
01394                             }
01395                         }
01396                         else
01397                         {
01398                             // Already visited newnode
01399                             if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01400                             {
01401                                 lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01402                                 lowlinkvar=newnode;
01403                             }
01404                         }
01405                     }
01406                 }
01407             }
01408             
01409             if(true //include_sink 
01410                 && usage[curnode-numvars]>lower[curnode-numvars])  // adaptation for GCC instead of the following comment.
01411             //valinlocalmatching.in(curnode-numvars))
01412             {
01413                 int newnode=numvars+numvals;
01414                 if(!visited.in(newnode))
01415                 {
01416                     visit(newnode, false);
01417                     if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01418                     {
01419                         lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01420                         lowlinkvar=-1;
01421                     }
01422                 }
01423                 else
01424                 {
01425                     // Already visited newnode
01426                     if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01427                     {
01428                         lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01429                         lowlinkvar=-1;
01430                     }
01431                 }
01432             }
01433             
01434         }
01435         
01436         //cout << "On way back up, curnode:" << curnode<< ", lowlink:"<<lowlink[curnode]<< ", dfsnum:"<<dfsnum[curnode]<<endl;
01437         if(lowlink[curnode]==dfsnum[curnode])
01438         {
01439             // Did the SCC split?
01440             // Perhaps we traversed all vars but didn't unroll the recursion right to the top.
01441             // !toplevel . Or perhaps we didn't traverse all the variables. (or all values.)
01442             // I think these two cases cover everything.
01443             if(!toplevel || varcount<vars_in_scc.size() || valcount<vals_in_scc.size())
01444             {
01445                 scc_split=true;  // The SCC has split and there is some work to do later.
01446             }
01447             
01448             // Doing something with the components should not be necessary unless the scc has split.
01449             // The first SCC found is deep in the tree, so the flag will be set to its final value
01450             // the first time we are here.
01451             // so it is OK to assume that scc_split has been
01452             // set correctly before we do the following.
01453             if(scc_split)
01454             {
01455                 // For each variable and value, write it to the scc array.
01456                 // If its the last one, flip the bit.
01457                 
01458                 varinlocalmatching.clear();  // Borrow this datastructure for a minute.
01459                 
01460                 GCCPRINT("Writing new SCC:");
01461                 bool containsvars=false, containsvals=false;
01462                 for(vector<int>::iterator tstackit=(--tstack.end());  ; --tstackit)
01463                 {
01464                     int copynode=(*tstackit);
01465                     
01466                     if(copynode!=numvars+numvals) // if it is not t
01467                     {
01468                         if(copynode<numvars) containsvars=true;
01469                         else containsvals=true;
01470                         
01471                         int temp=SCCs[sccindex];
01472                         int tempi=varToSCCIndex[copynode];
01473                         
01474                         SCCs[sccindex]=copynode;
01475                         varToSCCIndex[copynode]=sccindex;
01476                         
01477                         SCCs[tempi]=temp;
01478                         varToSCCIndex[temp]=tempi;
01479                         sccindex++;
01480                         
01481                         if(copynode<numvars)
01482                         {
01483                             varinlocalmatching.insert(copynode);
01484                         }
01485                     }
01486                     
01487                     if(copynode==curnode)
01488                     {
01489                         // Beware it might be an SCC containing just one value.
01490                         // or just t
01491                         
01492                         if(containsvars || containsvals)   //containsvars
01493                         {
01494                             GCCPRINT("Inserting split point at "<< sccindex-1 << " SCCs:" << SCCs);
01495                             SCCSplit.remove(sccindex-1);
01496                         }
01497                         
01498                         // The one written last was the last one in the SCC.
01499                         break;
01500                     }
01501                     
01502                     // Should be no split points in the middle of writing an SCC.
01503                     //D_ASSERT(copynode==curnode || copynode>=numvars || SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex-1));
01504                 }
01505                 // Just print more stuff here.
01506                 
01507                 
01508                 // For each value, iterate through the current
01509                 // SCC and remove it from any other variable other
01510                 // than the one in this SCC.
01511                 //cout << "Starting loop"<<endl;
01512                 //if(containsvars) // why is this OK? because of bug above, in case where numnode is a variable.
01513                 {
01514                     while(true)
01515                     {
01516                         int copynode=(*(--tstack.end()));
01517                         
01518                         tstack.pop_back();
01519                         in_tstack.remove(copynode);
01520                         
01521                         if(copynode>=numvars && copynode!=(numvars+numvals))
01522                         {
01523                             // It's a value. Iterate through old SCC and remove it from
01524                             // any variables not in tempset.
01525                             //cout << "Trashing value "<< copynode+dom_min-numvars << endl;
01526                             for(int i=0; i<vars_in_scc.size(); i++)
01527                             {
01528                                 int curvar=vars_in_scc[i];
01529                                 if(!varinlocalmatching.in(curvar))
01530                                 {
01531                                     // var not in tempset so might have to do some test against matching.
01532                                     // Why doing this test? something wrong with the assigned variable optimization?
01533                                     if(varvalmatching[curvar]!=copynode+dom_min-numvars)
01534                                     {
01535                                         GCCPRINT("Removing var: "<< curvar << " val:" << copynode+dom_min-numvars);
01536                                         if(var_array[curvar].inDomain(copynode+dom_min-numvars))
01537                                         {
01538                                             var_array[curvar].removeFromDomain(copynode+dom_min-numvars);
01539                                             #ifdef INCGRAPH
01540                                                 adjlist_remove(curvar, copynode-numvars+dom_min);
01541                                             #endif
01542                                         }
01543                                     }
01544                                 }
01545                             }
01546                         }
01547                         
01548                         if(copynode==curnode)
01549                         {
01550                             break;
01551                         }
01552                     }
01553                 }
01554             }
01555         }
01556     }
01557     
01559     // Propagate to capacity variables.
01560     
01561     // can only be called when SCCs not used. 
01562     inline void prop_capacity()
01563     {
01564         if(Strongcards)
01565         {
01566             prop_capacity_strong();
01567         }
01568         else
01569         {
01570             prop_capacity_simple();   
01571         }
01572     }
01573     
01574     void prop_capacity_simple()
01575     {
01576         // basic prop from main vars to cap variables. equiv to occurrence constraints I think. 
01577         // NEEDS TO BE IMPROVED. but it would be quadratic (nd) whatever I do.
01578         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
01579         {
01580             int val=val_array[i];
01581             #ifndef INCGRAPH
01582                 int mincap=0;
01583                 int maxcap=0;
01584                 for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++)
01585                 {
01586                     if(var_array[j].inDomain(val))
01587                     {
01588                         maxcap++;
01589                         if(var_array[j].isAssigned())
01590                             mincap++;
01591                     }
01592                 }
01593                 capacity_array[i].setMin(mincap);
01594                 capacity_array[i].setMax(maxcap);
01595             #else
01596                 if(val>= dom_min && val<=dom_max)
01597                 {
01598                     int mincap=0;
01599                     for(int vari=0; vari<adjlistlength[val-dom_min+numvars]; vari++)
01600                     {
01601                         int var=adjlist[val-dom_min+numvars][vari];
01602                         if(var_array[var].isAssigned())
01603                             mincap++;
01604                     }
01605                     capacity_array[i].setMin(mincap);
01606                     capacity_array[i].setMax(adjlistlength[val-dom_min+numvars]);
01607                 }  // else the cap will already have been set to 0.
01608             #endif
01609             //if(mincap>lower[val-dom_min])
01610             //    lower[val-dom_min]=mincap;
01611             //if(maxcap<upper[val-dom_min])
01612             //    upper[val-dom_min]=maxcap;
01613         }
01614     }
01615     
01616     void prop_capacity_strong()
01617     {
01618         // Lower bounds.
01619         prop_capacity_simple();
01620         GCCPRINT("In prop_capacity_strong");
01621         
01622         // Temporary measure.
01623         vars_in_scc.clear();
01624         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01625         {
01626             vars_in_scc.push_back(i);
01627         }
01628         
01629         for(int validx=0; validx<val_array.size(); validx++)
01630         {
01631             int value=val_array[validx];
01632             if(value>=dom_min && value<=dom_max)
01633             {
01634                 // use the matching -- change it by lowering flow to value.
01635                 GCCPRINT("Calling bfsmatching_card_lowerbound for value "<< value);
01636                 int newlb=bfsmatching_card_lowerbound(value, lower[value-dom_min]);
01637                 GCCPRINT("bfsmatching_card_lowerbound Returned " << newlb);
01638                 
01639                 if(newlb > capacity_array[validx].getMin())
01640                 {
01641                     GCCPRINT("Improved lower bound "<< newlb);
01642                     capacity_array[validx].setMin(newlb);
01643                 }
01644                 
01645                 GCCPRINT("Calling card_upperbound for value "<< value);
01646                 int newub=card_upperbound(value, upper[value-dom_min]);
01647                 GCCPRINT("card_upperbound Returned " << newub);
01648                 
01649                 if(newub < capacity_array[validx].getMax())
01650                 {
01651                     GCCPRINT("Improved upper bound "<< newub);
01652                     capacity_array[validx].setMax(newub);
01653                 }
01654             }
01655             else
01656             {// this may not be neecded. Only needed if we're not calling prop_capacity_simple
01657                 capacity_array[validx].propagateAssign(0);
01658             }
01659         }
01660     }
01661     
01662     void prop_capacity_strong_scc(int value)
01663     {
01664         GCCPRINT("In prop_capacity_strong_scc(value)");
01665         // use the matching -- change it by lowering flow to value.
01666         GCCPRINT("Calling bfsmatching_card_lowerbound for value "<< value);
01667         // assumes vars_in_scc and vals_in_scc are already populated.
01668         
01669         int newlb=bfsmatching_card_lowerbound(value, lower[value-dom_min]);
01670         GCCPRINT("bfsmatching_card_lowerbound Returned " << newlb);
01671         int validx=val_to_cap_index[value-dom_min];
01672         if(newlb > capacity_array[validx].getMin())
01673         {
01674             GCCPRINT("Improved lower bound "<< newlb);
01675             capacity_array[validx].setMin(newlb);
01676         }
01677         
01678         GCCPRINT("Calling card_upperbound for value "<< value);
01679         int newub=card_upperbound(value, upper[value-dom_min]);
01680         GCCPRINT("card_upperbound Returned " << newub);
01681         
01682         if(newub < capacity_array[validx].getMax())
01683         {
01684             GCCPRINT("Improved upper bound "<< newub);
01685             capacity_array[validx].setMax(newub);
01686         }
01687     }
01688     
01689     // function to re-maximise a matching without using a particular value.
01690     // Used to find a new lowerbound for the value.
01691     // Changed copy of bfsmatching_gcc method above.
01692     
01693     // should stop when we reach the existing bound.
01694     inline int bfsmatching_card_lowerbound(int forbiddenval, int existinglb)
01695     {
01696         // lower and upper are indexed by value-dom_min and provide the capacities.
01697         // usage is the number of times a value is used in the matching.
01698         
01699         if(existinglb==usage[forbiddenval-dom_min])
01700         {
01701             //bound already supported
01702             return existinglb;
01703         }
01704         
01705         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
01706         if(boundsupported[(forbiddenval-dom_min)*2]==existinglb)
01707         {
01708             return existinglb;
01709         }
01710         #endif
01711         
01712         // current sccs are contained in vars_in_scc and vals_in_scc
01713         // back up the matching to restore afterwards.
01714         matchbac=varvalmatching;
01715         usagebac=usage;
01716         
01717         // clear out forbiddenval
01718         // instead of clearing it out, can we do something else?
01719         /*usage[forbiddenval-dom_min]=0;
01720         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01721         {
01722             if(varvalmatching[i]==forbiddenval)
01723             {
01724                 varvalmatching[i]=dom_min-1;
01725                 newlb++;
01726             }
01727         }*/
01728         int newlb=usage[forbiddenval-dom_min];  // new lower bound. When this passes existinglb, we can stop.
01729         
01730         /*for(int startvarscc=0; startvarscc<vars_in_scc.size(); startvarscc++)
01731         {
01732             int startvar=vars_in_scc[startvarscc];
01733             if(varvalmatching[startvar]==forbiddenval)
01734             {
01735                 varvalmatching[startvar]=dom_min-1;
01736                 usage[forbiddenval-dom_min]--;
01737             }
01738         }*/
01739         
01740         // Flip the graph around, so it's like the alldiff case now. 
01741         // follow an edge in the matching from a value to a variable,
01742         // follow edges not in the matching from variables to values. 
01743         
01744         #ifdef INCGRAPH
01745         for(int startvari=0; startvari<adjlistlength[forbiddenval-dom_min+numvars] && newlb>existinglb; startvari++)
01746         {
01747             int startvar=adjlist[forbiddenval-dom_min+numvars][startvari];
01748         #else
01749         for(int startvarscc=0; startvarscc<vars_in_scc.size() && newlb>existinglb; startvarscc++)
01750         {
01751             int startvar=vars_in_scc[startvarscc];
01752         #endif
01753             if(varvalmatching[startvar]==forbiddenval)
01754             {
01755                 varvalmatching[startvar]=dom_min-1;
01756                 usage[forbiddenval-dom_min]--;
01757                 GCCPRINT("Searching for augmenting path for var: " << startvar);
01758                 fifo.clear();  // this should be constant time but probably is not.
01759                 fifo.push_back(startvar);
01760                 visited.clear();
01761                 visited.insert(startvar);
01762                 bool finished=false;
01763                 while(!fifo.empty() && !finished)
01764                 {
01765                     // pop a vertex and expand it.
01766                     int curnode=fifo.front();
01767                     fifo.pop_front();
01768                     GCCPRINT("Popped vertex " << (curnode<numvars? "(var)":"(val)") << (curnode<numvars? curnode : curnode+dom_min-numvars ));
01769                     if(curnode<numvars)
01770                     { // it's a variable
01771                         // follow all edges other than the matching edge. 
01772                         #ifndef INCGRAPH
01773                         for(int valtoqueue=var_array[curnode].getMin(); valtoqueue<=var_array[curnode].getMax(); valtoqueue++)
01774                         {
01775                         #else
01776                         for(int valtoqueuei=0; valtoqueuei<adjlistlength[curnode]; valtoqueuei++)
01777                         {
01778                             int valtoqueue=adjlist[curnode][valtoqueuei];
01779                         #endif
01780                             // For each value, check if it terminates an odd alternating path
01781                             // and also queue it if it is suitable.
01782                             int validx=valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars;
01783                             if(valtoqueue!=varvalmatching[curnode]
01784                                 && valtoqueue!=forbiddenval  // added for this method.
01785                             #ifndef INCGRAPH
01786                                 && var_array[curnode].inDomain(valtoqueue)
01787                             #endif
01788                                 && !visited.in(validx) )
01789                             {
01790                                 //D_ASSERT(find(vals_in_scc.begin(), vals_in_scc.end(), valtoqueue)!=vals_in_scc.end()); // the value is in the scc.
01791                                 // Does this terminate an augmenting path?
01792                                 if(usage[valtoqueue-dom_min]<upper[valtoqueue-dom_min])
01793                                 {
01794                                     // valtoqueue terminates an alternating path.
01795                                     // Unwind and apply the path here
01796                                     prev[validx]=curnode;
01797                                     apply_augmenting_path_reverse(validx, startvar);
01798                                     finished=true;
01799                                     newlb--;  // update bound counter
01800                                     break;  // get out of for loop
01801                                 }
01802                                 else
01803                                 {
01804                                     // queue valtoqueue
01805                                     visited.insert(validx);
01806                                     prev[validx]=curnode;
01807                                     fifo.push_back(validx);
01808                                 }
01809                             }
01810                         }  // end for.
01811                     }
01812                     else
01813                     { // popped a value from the stack.
01814                         D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode < numvars+numvals);
01815                         int stackval=curnode+dom_min-numvars;
01816                         #ifdef INCGRAPH
01817                         for(int vartoqueuei=0; vartoqueuei<adjlistlength[curnode]; vartoqueuei++)
01818                         {
01819                             int vartoqueue=adjlist[curnode][vartoqueuei];
01820                         #else
01821                         for(int vartoqueuescc=0; vartoqueuescc<vars_in_scc.size(); vartoqueuescc++)
01822                         {
01823                             int vartoqueue=vars_in_scc[vartoqueuescc];
01824                         #endif
01825                             // For each variable which is matched to stackval, queue it.
01826                             if(!visited.in(vartoqueue)
01827                                 && varvalmatching[vartoqueue]==stackval)
01828                             {
01829                                 D_ASSERT(var_array[vartoqueue].inDomain(stackval));
01830                                 // there is an edge from stackval to vartoqueue.
01831                                 // queue vartoqueue
01832                                 visited.insert(vartoqueue);
01833                                 prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
01834                                 fifo.push_back(vartoqueue);
01835                             }
01836                         }  // end for.
01837                     }  // end value
01838                 }  // end while
01839             }
01840         }
01841         
01842         GCCPRINT("maximum matching:" << varvalmatching);
01843         
01844         if(newlb==existinglb)
01845         {
01846             GCCPRINT("Stopped because new lower bound would be less than or equal the existing lower bound.");
01847         }
01848         
01849         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
01850         boundsupported[(forbiddenval-dom_min)*2]=usage[forbiddenval-dom_min];
01851         DynamicTrigger* dt=dynamic_trigger_start();
01852         dt+=(numvars*numvals);  // skip over the first block of triggers
01853         dt+=val_to_cap_index[forbiddenval-dom_min]*(val_array.size()+numvars)*2;  // move to the area for the value.
01854         //dt+=(val_array.size()+numvars);  // move to upper bound area
01855         // now put down the triggers for varvalmatching and usage
01856         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01857         {
01858             D_ASSERT((dt+i)->trigger_info() == (forbiddenval-dom_min)*2);
