01859             var_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+i, DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[i]);
01860         }
01861         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
01862         {
01863             D_ASSERT((dt+numvars+i)->trigger_info() == (forbiddenval-dom_min)*2);
01864             
01865             if(val_array[i]>= dom_min && val_array[i]<= dom_max)
01866             {
01867                 capacity_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+numvars+i, DomainRemoval, usage[val_array[i]-dom_min]);
01868             }
01869             else
01870             {
01871                 capacity_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+numvars+i, DomainRemoval, 0);
01872             }
01873         }
01874         #endif
01875         
01876         varvalmatching=matchbac;
01877         usage=usagebac;
01878         
01879         return newlb;
01880     }
01881     
01882     inline int card_upperbound(int value, int existingub)
01883     {
01884         // lower and upper are indexed by value-dom_min and provide the capacities.
01885         // usage is the number of times a value is used in the matching.
01886         
01887         if(existingub==usage[value-dom_min])
01888         {
01889             // bound is already supported
01890             return existingub;
01891         }
01892         
01893         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
01894         if(boundsupported[(value-dom_min)*2+1]==existingub)
01895         {
01896             return existingub;
01897         }
01898         #endif
01899         
01900         // current sccs are contained in vars_in_scc and vals_in_scc
01901         
01902         int startvalindex=value-dom_min;
01903         while(usage[startvalindex]<existingub)
01904         {
01905             // usage of value needs to increase. Construct an augmenting path starting at value.
01906             GCCPRINT("Searching for augmenting path for val: " << value);
01907             // Matching edge lost; BFS search for augmenting path to fix it.
01908             fifo.clear();  // this should be constant time but probably is not.
01909             fifo.push_back(startvalindex+numvars);
01910             visited.clear();
01911             visited.insert(startvalindex+numvars);
01912             bool finished=false;
01913             while(!fifo.empty() && !finished)
01914             {
01915                 // pop a vertex and expand it.
01916                 int curnode=fifo.front();
01917                 fifo.pop_front();
01918                 GCCPRINT("Popped vertex " << (curnode<numvars? "(var)":"(val)") << (curnode<numvars? curnode : curnode+dom_min-numvars ));
01919                 if(curnode<numvars)
01920                 { // it's a variable
01921                     // follow the matching edge, if there is one.
01922                     int valtoqueue=varvalmatching[curnode];
01923                     if(valtoqueue!=dom_min-1 
01924                         && !visited.in(valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars))
01925                     {
01926                         D_ASSERT(var_array[curnode].inDomain(valtoqueue));
01927                         int validx=valtoqueue-dom_min+numvars;
01928                         if(usage[valtoqueue-dom_min]>lower[valtoqueue-dom_min])
01929                         {
01930                             // can reduce the flow of valtoqueue to increase startval.
01931                             prev[validx]=curnode;
01932                             apply_augmenting_path(validx, startvalindex+numvars);
01933                             finished=true;
01934                         }
01935                         else
01936                         {
01937                             visited.insert(validx);
01938                             prev[validx]=curnode;
01939                             fifo.push_back(validx);
01940                         }
01941                     }
01942                 }
01943                 else
01944                 { // popped a value from the stack.
01945                     D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode < numvars+numvals);
01946                     int stackval=curnode+dom_min-numvars;
01947                     #ifndef INCGRAPH
01948                     for(int vartoqueuescc=0; vartoqueuescc<vars_in_scc.size(); vartoqueuescc++)
01949                     {
01950                         int vartoqueue=vars_in_scc[vartoqueuescc];
01951                     #else
01952                     for(int vartoqueuei=0; vartoqueuei<adjlistlength[curnode]; vartoqueuei++)
01953                     {
01954                         int vartoqueue=adjlist[curnode][vartoqueuei];
01955                     #endif
01956                         // For each variable, check if it terminates an odd alternating path
01957                         // and also queue it if it is suitable.
01958                         if(!visited.in(vartoqueue)
01959                             #ifndef INCGRAPH
01960                             && var_array[vartoqueue].inDomain(stackval)
01961                             #endif
01962                             && varvalmatching[vartoqueue]!=stackval)   // Need to exclude the matching edges????
01963                         {
01964                             // there is an edge from stackval to vartoqueue.
01965                             if(varvalmatching[vartoqueue]==dom_min-1)
01966                             {
01967                                 // vartoqueue terminates an odd alternating path.
01968                                 // Unwind and apply the path here
01969                                 prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
01970                                 apply_augmenting_path(vartoqueue, startvalindex+numvars);
01971                                 finished=true;
01972                                 break;  // get out of for loop
01973                             }
01974                             else
01975                             {
01976                                 // queue vartoqueue
01977                                 visited.insert(vartoqueue);
01978                                 prev[vartoqueue]=curnode;
01979                                 fifo.push_back(vartoqueue);
01980                             }
01981                         }
01982                     }  // end for.
01983                 }  // end value
01984             }  // end while
01985             if(!finished)
01986             {   // no augmenting path found
01987                 GCCPRINT("No augmenting path found.");
01988                 // restore the matching to its state before the algo was called.
01989                 break;
01990             }
01991             
01992         }  // end while
01993         
01994         //varvalmatching=matchbac;
01995         //usage=usagebac;
01996         #ifdef CAPBOUNDSCACHE
01997         boundsupported[(value-dom_min)*2+1]=usage[startvalindex];
01998         DynamicTrigger* dt=dynamic_trigger_start();
01999         dt+=(numvars*numvals);  // skip over the first block of triggers
02000         dt+=val_to_cap_index[value-dom_min]*(val_array.size()+numvars)*2;  // move to the area for the value.
02001         dt+=(val_array.size()+numvars);  // move to upper bound area
02002         // now put down the triggers for varvalmatching and usage
02003         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
02004         {
02005             D_ASSERT((dt+i)->trigger_info() == (value-dom_min)*2+1);
02006             var_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+i, DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[i]);
02007         }
02008         for(int i=0; i<val_array.size(); i++)
02009         {
02010             D_ASSERT((dt+numvars+i)->trigger_info() == (value-dom_min)*2+1);
02011             if(val_array[i]>= dom_min && val_array[i]<= dom_max)
02012             {
02013                 capacity_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+numvars+i, DomainRemoval, usage[val_array[i]-dom_min]);
02014             }
02015             else
02016             {
02017                 capacity_array[i].addDynamicTrigger(dt+numvars+i, DomainRemoval, 0);
02018             }
02019         }
02020         #endif
02021         
02022         return usage[startvalindex];
02023     }
02024     
02025     typedef typename VarArray2::value_type CapVarRef;
02026     virtual AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
02027     {
02028         // use a watched-or of NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint, i.e. the negation of occurrence
02029         vector<AbstractConstraint*> con;
02030         for(int i=0; i<capacity_array.size(); i++)
02031         {
02032             NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray1, DomainInt, CapVarRef>*
02033                 t=new NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray1, DomainInt, CapVarRef>(
02034                     stateObj, var_array, val_array[i], capacity_array[i]);
02035             con.push_back((AbstractConstraint*) t);
02036         }
02037         return new Dynamic_OR(stateObj, con);
02038     }
02039 };
02040 
02041 // Note: should not attempt to prune capacity variables when they are assigned.
02042 // It seems to do so for both strong and weak variants.
02043 
02044 #endif
